Incident.Summary: Traffic stop resulting in DUI arrest.

AddressCommonName.CommonPlaceName: WB BYPASS AT NAYLOR MILL RD
SB BYPASS AT RAMP TO RT 13
RAMP TO NB BYPASS RT WB 50
NB BYPASS EXIT RAMP TO CENTRE RD

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Patrol Vehicle E6 is equipped with in an in-car camera Dash Cam footage: Not recording at time of incident. Body Cam Footage: https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=3decf3318fc94f7eb9523f25b405eb95partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 In Car Camera: Did not upload correctly. Crime: Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol Weather: Clear Defendant: Jose Moises Garcia Sanchez Date of Birth: 06/11/1994 Date of Arrest: 07/05/2023 Time of Arrest: 0614 hours License: MD-10273413205 DUI #: 23-54-136 DUI Citation #: 0FG0YX8 Subsequent Offender: Yes Accident Involved: No SCENE PROCESSING: * DR15 Advice of Rights * DR15A CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING: * I am trained to administer standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. Phase #1 - Vehicle In Motion: See Corporal Webers supplemental report. Phase #2 - Personal Contact: I exited my patrol vehicle and contacted the operator of the vehicle, Jose Moises Garcia Sanchez. I identified myself to Sanchez, as well as the reason for the stop and that he was being audibly and visually recorded. While speaking with Sanchez, I detected the odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from inside the vehicle. Sanchezs eyes were bloodshot and glassy. Phase #3 - Pre-Arrest Screening: I asked Sanchez to exit the vehicle. Once outside the vehicle, I could still detect the odor of an alcoholic beverage even more clearly coming from Sanchezs breath and person. I recognized there was an apparent language barrier and originally asked Sanchez if he had someone who could translate for him. I then began to use Google Translate before Cpl. Weber advised me that he could understand enough English to perform the tests. I asked Sanchez if he wanted to perform standardized field sobriety tests. Sanchez stated he would. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus: I explained the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test to Sanchez. After explaining the test I asked him if he understood the test. Sanchez stated he understood the test and began. Resting Nystagmus: No Equal Tracking: Yes Equal Pupil Size: Yes Lack of Smooth Pursuit Both eyes Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degrees Total Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Clues:6 of 6 Walk and Turn: Weather: Clear Surface:Level asphalt free of any debris I instructed Sanchez into the instructional phase. I then explained and demonstrated the Walk and Turn test to Sanchez. Instructional Phase: Left Instructional Position 1st9 steps: Stopped walking Raised arms for balance Missed Heel-to-Toe Stepped off Line 2nd9 steps: Raised arms for balance Missed Heel-to-Toe Stepped off line Turn: Turn completed incorrectly; waddled around instead of keeping lead foot planted. Total Walk and Turn Clues: 6 of 8 One Leg Stand: I next explained and demonstrated the One Leg Stand test to Sanchez. Sanchez began the test. Clues: Raised Arms for Balance Total One Leg Stand Clues: 1of 4 Preliminary Breath Test: I explained to Sanchez the reasons for using a preliminary breath test, and asked if he wanted to submit a breath sample. Sanchez refused the preliminary breath test. Arrest and Transport: Based on the following, I had reason to believe Sanchez was driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol: * Sanchezs driving behavior * Eyes bloodshot and glassy * The strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his breath and person * Admittance to consuming alcoholic beverages * Observations during SFSTs Sanchez was placed under arrest for Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol at 0614 hours. 20 Minute Observation Period: Sanchez was played the Spanish DR-15 Advice of Rights when we arrived at the Maryland State Police Salisbury Barrack. Sanchez refused to submit to the intoximeter test at 0633 hours and signed the DR-15. I request this case closed. All events occurred in Wicomico County, MD.

DUI # 23-54-136 MSP Case # 23-MSP-024065 Defendant: Jose Moises Garcia Sanchez Date of Birth: 06/11/1994 Date of Arrest: 7/5/2023 Time of Arrest: 0614 hours VIDEO EVIDENCE: MSP Vehicle E-05 is NOT equipped with an in-car camera (ICC). I have been issued a Body Worn Camera (BWC) Body Worn Camera partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1" style="color:#0563c1; text-decoration:underline">https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=2f6ab4b52c764fa19339655356cfbc71partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Front facing in-car camera No ICC in E-05 Front facing (transport) in-car camera No ICC in E-05 TRAINING/CERTIFICATES: * Certified Drug Recognition Expert (DRE) through the International Association of Chiefs of Police (IACP). * Certified Standardize Field Sobriety Tests (SFST) Instructor through the Maryland State Police and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). * Trained in administering Standardize Field Sobriety Tests (SFST) through the Maryland State Police and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). * Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (ARIDE) Certification. * Traffic Safety Specialist Level 2 Certification through the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). NARRATIVE: Vehicle in Motion (Phase 1) On 7/05/2023 at approximately 0549 hours, I was patrolling northbound on the Salisbury Bypass south of Route 13 in lane number one. At that time, I observed a red Toyota Corolla traveling northbound on the Salisbury Bypass south of Route 13 ahead of me in lane number two. I observed that vehicle appeared to be traveling well above the posted speed limit as it was quickly passing other vehicles on the roadway. As I attempted to catch to the vehicle, I observed the vehicle cross over the solid white line traffic control device and enter the right shoulder by more than half a vehicle width and continue driving half on the shoulder for several seconds. As I approached the vehicle I was able to conduct a pace of the vehicle for approximately .1 of a mile and found the vehicle to be traveling at 90 mph in a posted 65 mph zone. I activated my emergency equipment and conducted a traffic stop on the vehicle. I observed the displayed Maryland registration 6FB8371. Personal Contact (Phase 2) I made contact with the operator of the vehicle who I identified by his Maryland drivers license Jose Moises Garcia Sanchez (H/M, DOB 06/11/1994). I immediately detected the moderate odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the vehicle. While speaking with Garcia Sanchez, I observed his eyes to be watery and bloodshot. When I asked Garcia Sanchez if he had anything alcoholic to drink, Garcia Sanchez stated that he had been drinking last night in Ocean City. Tpr. Pilchard #7582 then arrived on-scene and conducted the Standardized Field Sobriety Tests (SFSTs).
